cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 385 mi SE of Wilmington North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the southeastern North Carolina/South Carolina coast, then expected to slow and drift west-southwest inland over the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Cape Fear-Surf City stretch of the North Carolina coast (close to Wilmington, NC)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC; Storm Surge Watch north of Duck NC to NC/VA border and Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from South Santee River SC to Duck NC, including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds; Storm Surge Warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Neuse & Pamlico Rivers
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire North Carolina coast and northern South Carolina coast (South Santee River SC to Duck NC) including Wilmington/Cape Fear region
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane conditions with sustained winds 74–110+ mph possible; 33% chance of 64-kt (74 mph) winds at the port, 85% chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 6–9 ft forecast from North Myrtle Beach SC to Cape Fear NC, including Wilmington area, with large destructive waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: Catastrophic rainfall totals of 20–30 inches (isolated 40 inches) possible along coastal North Carolina including Wilmington, causing flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential tornadoes beginning late Thursday; dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged power outages and significant river flooding likely.
